User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user within the Vibely application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

username.description: The username chosen by the user.

avatarUrl.description: URL of the user's avatar image.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was last updated.

Channel.title: Channel
Channel.description: Represents a channel within the Vibely application, where users can send messages.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Channel entity.

isPublic.description: Indicates whether the channel is public or private.

ownerId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Channel) ID of the user who owns the channel.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the channel was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the channel was last updated.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message sent within a channel.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Message entity.

channelId.description: Reference to Channel. (Relationship: Channel 1:N Message) ID of the channel the message belongs to.

senderId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Message) ID of the user who sent the message.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was last updated.

ChannelMembership.title: ChannelMembership
ChannelMembership.description: Represents the relationship between a User and a Channel (many-to-many).

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChannelMembership entity.

channelId.description: Reference to Channel. (Relationship: Channel N:N User)

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User N:N Channel)

joinedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user joined the channel.

Attachment.title: Attachment
Attachment.description: Represents an attachment associated with a message.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Attachment entity.

mimeType.description: MIME type of the attached file.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the attachment was uploaded.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure, scalable, and easily maintainable backend for the Vibely application, prioritizing authorization independence and clarity. The key strategy is denormalization to avoid complex `get()` calls in security rules, ensuring atomic operations and easy debugging.

*   **User Data:** User profiles are stored in `/users/{userId}` using Path-Based ownership. This makes user data private and easily manageable with security rules based on `request.auth.uid`.
*   **Channels:** Channels are stored in a top-level `/channels` collection.  `ChannelMembership` documents are denormalized into the `channels` documents using a map called `members`.  The `ownerId` is also maintained on the Channel. This design allows for easy querying of channels and simplifies security rules.
*   **Messages:** Messages are stored in subcollections under each channel (`/channels/{channelId}/messages/{messageId}`). This supports efficient querying of messages within a channel. The `senderId` is used for identifying the author of the message.
*   **Attachments:** Attachments are stored in subcollections under each message (`/channels/{channelId}/messages/{messageId}/attachments/{attachmentId}`).

**Authorization Independence & QAPs:**

*   The denormalization of channel members into the `members` field inside the `channel` documents facilitates Authorization Independence. Security rules can validate membership directly on the `channel` document without needing to `get()` the `ChannelMembership` document. This also enables secure listing of channels accessible to a user (QAP).
*   Path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}`) for private user data supports secure QAPs as rules can filter based on `request.auth.uid` without further `get()` calls.

**Data Clarity and Predictability:**

*   Explicit path structures and field naming conventions are used to make the database schema easy to understand and maintain. Timestamps (`createdAt`, `updatedAt`) are consistently used across all entities.

This design adheres to all core design principles and strategy mandates, creating a robust and secure foundation for the Vibely application.
